meanings.definition: A soft-bodied legless larva, especially that of a fly, found in decaying matter.
meanings.sent1: The maggot wriggled in the rotting apple.
meanings.sent2: Flies lay eggs that hatch into maggots.
meanings.sent3: The maggot thought it was a champion at hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The maggot's journey through the decaying world was like a tiny explorer's adventure.
meanings.sent5: The squirming maggot in the compost heap was a scene straight out of a nature documentary.

meanings.sent1: He's such a maggot, always lying to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The bully was known as a maggot in school.
meanings.sent3: The maggot tried to cheat at the game but got caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: Her deceitful friend turned out to be a maggot in disguise.
meanings.sent5: The maggot's betrayal stung more than a thousand bee stings.
